thread.title: LISTEN: 24-hour songwriting challenge pumps out awesome new tunes
thread.title_full: LISTEN: 24-hour songwriting challenge pumps out awesome new tunes

author: Bobby Olivier | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: LISTEN: 24-hour songwriting challenge pumps out awesome new tunes
text:
Comments 
ASBURY PARK — For the second year, a local music blog's challenge was met with an expansive batch of new rock, punk, folk and more. 
Dozens of bands from New Jersey, New York and Pennsylvania partook in a 24-hour songwriting challenge Sept. 12, organized by Speak Into My Good Eye , an Asbury Park-based music website. All songs had to be written and recorded from scratch within a day. 
MORE: Check out a Jersey lounge singer's bright pop debut 
The site released the fruits of its bands' all-night labor last week, 37 fresh tracks that prove great songs can be written and recorded under the harshest of deadlines. 
Highlights from the mix include a trotting folk tune from Brick players Bone and Marrow, and a nearly six-minute offering from Jersey rocker Julian Fulton that feels impossibly polished considering the time constraint. 
Each song is available for free listening and/or purchase here , or you can listen below. All proceeds benefit the National Alliance on Mental Illness. 
Give the whole playlist a chance — these are some wonderfully talented local musicians. &amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;a href="http://speakimge.bandcamp.com/album/the-2nd-annual-24-hour-songwriting-challenge" data-mce-href="http://speakimge.bandcamp.com/album/the-2nd-annual-24-hour-songwriting-challenge"&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;The 2nd Annual 24 Hour Songwriting Challenge by Speak Into My Good Eye&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/a&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
